title: FINAL BOSS: Sourdough Pete's Syndicate Headquarters
description: Face the ultimate challenge: infiltrate Sourdough Pete's Alaskan command center, the mastermind behind the entire Sourdough Syndicate. This expert-level case requires mastery of all geographic skills to uncover the organization's global conspiracy.

briefing.headline: European geographical boundaries are under surveillance!
briefing.narrativeHtml:
INTERPOL ALERT: Professor Atlas (Viktor Kowalski), distinguished Eastern European cartography expert, has been stealing traditional and modern surveying equipment across European landscapes. He claims to be documenting 'cartographic fraud' in official boundary representations but his methods threaten international mapping agreements.

Educational Mission: Follow this meticulous scholar from his traditional cartography laboratory through field surveying expeditions to university teaching, learning about the evolution of mapping technology, European geography, and the importance of accurate boundary documentation!

Challenge Level: Intermediate-Advanced - requires understanding of surveying techniques, European geography, and cartographic technology evolution.

villains.name: Professor Atlas (Prof. Viktor Kowalski)
villains.title: Historical Cartography & Eastern European Geography Expert
villains.description: Distinguished geographer with PhD from University of Warsaw. Expert in historical boundary changes and obsessed with preserving accurate records of European political and cultural landscape evolution.

rounds.clueHtml:
Cartographic Equipment Theft Report: 'Professor Atlas photographed in his European countryside laboratory where traditional surveying instruments meet cutting-edge technology. He holds both a GPS device and modern mapping tablet while surrounded by antique theodolites, compasses, and rolled maps - the perfect blend of historical and digital cartography tools.'

Technology Bridge Evidence: 'Security footage shows him comparing traditional compass readings with GPS coordinates, demonstrating how modern technology validates centuries-old surveying principles. The theft occurred near medieval castles where ancient boundaries meet modern mapping needs.'

Geographic Context: Identify the type of European landscape where traditional cartography meets modern technology!

He claims these deep gorges and winding waterways represent fundamental geographical features often misrepresented in official maps.'

Topographic Evidence: 'Security reports show him documenting how water erosion creates complex topographic features - canyon walls, meandering rivers, and varied terrain that traditional surveying struggles to map accurately. His stolen GPS equipment provides precise coordinates for areas where topographic complexity challenges conventional boundary mapping.'

Educational Context: 'Security footage shows him in a distinguished green academic blazer, using pointers and topographic materials to instruct students about European boundary systems. The classroom setting provides perfect cover for his cartographic espionage operations while maintaining his scholarly reputation.'

rounds.clueHtml:
FINAL IDENTITY CONFIRMATION: 'Professor Atlas photographed in a historic Eastern European city with distinctive medieval architecture - cathedral, clock tower, and defensive walls along a flowing river. He uses modern theodolite surveying equipment to document these preserved urban areas while wearing professional attire with leather surveying satchel.'

Cultural Specialization Revealed: 'The location features authentic Polish/Eastern European architectural styles with Gothic cathedral, medieval clock tower, and historic defensive walls - exactly matching Professor Atlas's regional expertise. His modern surveying techniques applied to historic city preservation reveal his true identity: PROFESSOR VIKTOR KOWALSKI, Eastern European cartography specialist!'

resolution.summaryHtml:
